intro: Secamone tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, yellow or orange flowers, which are typically tubular in shape. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Secamone tenuifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
